reviewText: A pick up and play game, Lead and Gold has some good points going for it: very skill-based, team-supportive, and a decent variety of maps and graphics. It's a fun game, when it's not utterly chaotic. Explosions, one-hit kills, and anyone able to pop up anywhere (there are no choke points in any map) can make for a very random, hectic, and skill-less battle at times.\n\nBut if you can put up with it's unforgiving, crazy nature, it's rewarding. Unfortunately there are just a lot of games that do this style way better. The most unique thing it has going for it is the Wild West. 4/10

While cheep I don't recommend the game. Lead and Gold is basically a TF2 clone just without class balance. Very neat concepts with the synergies, reviving, mobile spawn point and objective based game play but the tutorial summed up the game best. After some simple text explanations 4 bots spawn in and bum rushed the spawn point, this in turn allowed them to continuously and repetitively killing me over and over again until I just put my hands up after I'd had enough of it- this is not good game play.

In multiplayer if you're on the winning side it's sadistically fun to pin the enemy in their spawn and just pick them off (of course) while they try desperately to gain a foothold. But on the losing team its just a lesson in frustration and either way it's not a fun experience.
